intro: Ixia lutea var. ovata, commonly known as the golden ox-eye, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive orange center. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
